answers.answer: Hi.  The appropriateness of chemotherapy or radiation therapy would depend on what stage your mother's tumor is in, as well as your mother's "performance status".  Performance status refers to how strong your mother's body is, and how well her body can withstand the effects of treatment.  If your mother has a lot of other chronic illnesses, like heart disease, kidney disease or diabetes, these could all have a negative impact on her performance status.  If you can give some additional information regarding her stage and chronic illnesses, I may be able to give a clear answer as to which is the better treatment.  Offhand, chemotherapy which is placed directly into her bladder (called intravesical chemotherapy) may have lesser adverse effects on other nearby organs (e.g. the gastrointestinal tract) than radiation, but whether or not the treatment will be effective will depend on the stage of the tumor, as I have said earlier.

question: my mother had cancerous tumors removed from her blatter she is 84 years old, frail weight of 68 lbs. one doctor wants to treat her with radiation, another doctor says chemotheropy put directly into the bladder would be better. in your opinion which has less side effects and would help her more.
title: chemo or radiation
